intro: Bellinia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Peru, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late summer and attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Bellinia peruviana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
